info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 3:54PM EDT until August 14 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Bladen and Columbus.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. A Flash Flood Warning may be needed for some areas if excessively high rainfall amounts are observed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Bladenboro, Lisbon, Elkton, Emerson, Abbottsburg, Lagoon, Bladen Community College, Ruskin, Council, Carvers, Butters, Clarkton, White Lake, Dublin and Bladen County Hospital. - weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING
